block.para: How does a matrix \Mtrx{A} of size (m,n) determine a linear transformation L\from \RNr[n]\to \RNr[m]?
The matrix \Mtrx{A} has n columns. So we may multiply it on the right by a column vector \Vect{x}=(x_1,\dots ,x_n) with n entries:
The result is the matrix product below.
As \Mtrx{A} has m columns, the resulting matrix product is a vector in \RNr[m]. We take it as L(\Vect{x}), that is the vector into which L transforms \Vect{x}.
